results.title: Holding our ground
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the inspiring story of a group of Filipino women and their efforts to acquire land of their own in the post-Marcos era. It looks at the plight of a group of women on the outskirts of Cebu, the second largest city in the Phillipines, who make their living as sidewalk sellers. Their story unfolds in the political arena of the Aquino Government, whose promises for land reform have never materialised. Interweaved with their struggle is the story of the evergrowing population of streetkids who beg and their struggle to survive. This is a powerful example of women and children, traditionally viewed as powerless, taking the future into their own hands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Henderson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Time and motion
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Discusses action photography, demonstrating how to capture the precise instant in which all elements of the photograph come together to form the most perfect construction, tension and drama. Guest photographers describe various approaches to action photography.

results.title: The Studio
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explains how the studio setting allows the photographer maximum control of all the elements of the photograph. Jerry Abramowits, a “product photographer”, shows the photographer’s responsibilities in a typical advertising assignment, while Sandi Fellman discusses the world of fashion photography.

results.title: Controlling exposure
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Designed to help students become more aware of the qualities and effects of available light. Jack Welpott shows various indoor and outdoor settings and describes the way he responds to specific lighting conditions. Explores the emotional and aesthetic effects of light together with the technical aspects.

results.title: Image and Impact
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Introduces the philosophy of this 20 part course which previews program guests and concepts to be taught over the series. Photographic vision is seen as a means of personal growth and individual expression.

results.title: Entertainment storytelling
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Video tech”.
This program allows the viewer to consolidate what they have learned in the other episodes of the series and apply these to the production of an entertainment story. Follow the production of an actual story from the initial stages of choosing and developing an idea, researching the background, planning work which has to be done on the shoot, getting the shots needed for the story, shotlisting, and doing an interview through to post-production and the screening of the final product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions

results.title: Visual story telling
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Video tech”.
This program presents a structured look at the practice and technique of video story telling. It looks at the sequencing of shots and how they work to advance a story, the planning of shots, the shooting of a sequence and the placement of the camera when shooting. It focusses on continuity and the factors to watch when editing so that shots will flow from one to the other and not seem illogical in the finished product.

results.title: Planet Earth
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
From the tempest and chaos of the early beginnings of our solar system, the planets were born. It is believed that from a collision of smaller bodies orbiting the sun, bigger objects were formed into the planets. The Earth underwent a severe heating and cooling which accounts for its structure. This episode examines the Earth from a planetary perspective. Unique in our solar system, the planet contains large bodies of water and an oxygen, rather than carbon dioxide based atmosphere; optimum conditions for the formation of organic life. In terms of the Earth’s geological age, the presence of life happened relatively late in the Earths’ life cycle.

results.title: Stellar formations
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
The night sky is deceptive. The black spaces between the stars are not empty. This interstella medium, filled with dust and gases, is in fact the nursery of young stars. From these dusty clouds of chemicals, stars are born, triggered by an event that turns cold and dense clumps of matter and molecules into a celestial body like our sun. This episode looks at the amazing phenomenon of stellar formation and the importance of interstellar medium and nebulae.

results.title: Multimedia: opportunities for Australia
results.creator_credit: Laura Zusters, Ben Cardillo and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A forum in which members of the Australian multimedia industry discuss opportunities and issues affecting the development of their industry. This program will be helpful for companies, policy makers, educational institutions and industry analysts wishing to gain an overview of those in the Australian small business community developing multimedia products.
